title: Area Mapping in Voluminous Virtual Environments
desc: Design of a balanced distributed architecture for isolated clients in a large and shared virtual environment. Backend services scale horizontally and use HDFS to provide partition tolerance and high availability of data. Results show several thousand clients moving about a multi-terabyte environment with marginal latencies.

title: Pastry Peer-to-Peer Network
desc: Comprehensive, scalable and efficient architecture for peer-to-peer applications. Peers are self organizing, with assigned 16-bit identifiers and form a decentralized logical overlay. Lookup requests leverage a leaf set and distributed hash table to ensure message are delivered in O(log N) hops.

title: Distributed, Replicated, and Fault Tolerant File System
desc: A failure-resilient file system where fault tolerance if achieved using two techniques: replication and erasure coding. This architecture is similar to the Google File System and provides partition tolerance and high availability of data. Each technique is configurable for different requirements; contrasting storage efficiency and resource utilization.
